test_cases.name: E2E - Successful User Onboarding, Formula Metric Creation, and Custom Target Configuration
preconditions: The test environment is stable and the application is accessible at the specified Base URL.
A valid user account with permissions to invite users and create metrics exists.
The prerequisite metrics ('First_Metric', 'Second_Metric') already exist in the system.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the Application URL.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
test_steps.expected_result: The password input field appears.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is successfully logged in and the company selection page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Locate and click on the correct company from the list.
test_steps.expected_result: The company is selected and the user is navigated to the main dashboard.

test_steps.action: Click on 'Administration' to expand the dropdown menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The Administration dropdown menu appears.

test_steps.action: Click on 'Manage Users' in the dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Manage Users' page loads successfully.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Invite Users' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Invite Users' modal appears.

test_steps.action: Enter the email address of the user to be invited.
test_steps.expected_result: The email address is correctly entered in the input field.

test_steps.action: Set the 'Admin' checkbox state according to the test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Admin' checkbox state matches the test data.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Send Invite' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The invitation is sent and the modal closes.

test_steps.action: Scroll to the 'Pending Invitations' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Pending Invitations' section and table are visible.

test_steps.action: Find the invited user in the 'Pending Invitations' table.
test_steps.expected_result: The invited user's email is found in the table.

test_steps.action: Click the tick/checkmark symbol in the Actions column for the invited user.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Accept Invite' form opens.

test_steps.action: On the 'Accept Invite' form, enter the user's first name.
test_steps.expected_result: The first name is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's last name.
test_steps.expected_result: The last name is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Enter and create a password for the new user.
test_steps.expected_result: The password is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Accept Invite' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The new user account is created successfully.

test_steps.action: Verify navigation to the dashboard after successful account creation.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is automatically logged in and redirected to the main dashboard.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the 'Metrics' page from the navigation menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The Metrics page loads successfully.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter the metric name.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric name is entered in the 'Name' field.

test_steps.action: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Formula Builder' interface becomes visible.

test_steps.action: Search for and select the first metric for the formula.
test_steps.expected_result: The first metric appears in the formula display area.

test_steps.action: Click on the desired operator button.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected operator appears in the formula display area.

test_steps.action: Search for and select the second metric for the formula.
test_steps.expected_result: The second metric appears in the formula display area.

test_steps.action: Verify the complete formula is displayed correctly.
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is displayed in the format: (Metric) [Operator] (Metric).

test_steps.action: Select the specified 'Cadence' from the dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected cadence is displayed.

test_steps.action: If Cadence is 'Weekly', select the 'Resets On' day.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected day is displayed. This step is skipped for other cadences.

test_steps.action: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is accepted and validated.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric is saved successfully and the user is returned to the Metrics page.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' via the 'Dashboards' menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'My Dashboard' page loads and the 'My KPIs' section is visible.

test_steps.action: Locate and click the 'Edit KPI' icon/button.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Edit KPI' modal opens with available and selected metrics panels.

test_steps.action: Locate the newly created metric in the left panel of available metrics.
test_steps.expected_result: The new metric is visible in the left panel.

test_steps.action: Click the metric in the left panel to move it to the right panel.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric moves from the left panel to the right 'selected' panel.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The modal closes and the dashboard refreshes to show the newly added metric in 'My KPIs'.

test_steps.action: Hover over the newly added metric card.
test_steps.expected_result: The three-dot menu button becomes visible.

test_steps.action: Click the three-dot menu button.
test_steps.expected_result: A dropdown menu with options like 'Edit' appears.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit' option in the dropdown menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The Edit page for the metric loads completely.

test_steps.action: Select the 'Target' tab if it is not already active.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration options are displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the 'Custom' radio button.
test_steps.expected_result: Four target input fields appear for Level 1, 2, 3, and 4.

test_steps.action: Enter the Level 1, Level 2, Level 3, and Level 4 target values.
test_steps.expected_result: All four target values are entered correctly in their respective fields.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to save the target configuration.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration is saved and the page navigates back to the dashboard.

test_steps.action: Locate the metric card on the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric card displays visual indicators for the configured custom target.

test_cases.name: Successful Metric Creation using an Existing Metric as Value Source
preconditions: The user is logged in and has navigated to the 'Metrics' page.
The metric to be selected as a source ('Metric_to_Select') already exists in the system.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the 'Metrics' page from the navigation menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The Metrics page loads successfully.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter the metric name.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric name is entered in the 'Name' field.

test_steps.action: Select 'Metric' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The UI updates to show a metric selection interface.

test_steps.action: Search for and select the desired existing metric from the dropdown/list.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected existing metric is displayed as the source.

test_steps.action: Select the specified 'Cadence' from the dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected cadence is displayed.

test_steps.action: If Cadence is 'Weekly', select the 'Resets On' day.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected day is displayed. This step is skipped for other cadences.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The new metric is successfully created and saved.

test_cases.name: Successful Configuration of a Time-Based Target for a Dashboard Metric
preconditions: The user is logged in and is on the 'My Dashboard' page.
The metric to be edited already exists and is visible in the 'My KPIs' section.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'My Dashboard'.
test_steps.expected_result: The dashboard renders and the 'My KPIs' section is visible.

test_steps.action: Identify and select the correct metric card for the target metric.
test_steps.expected_result: The correct metric card is located on the dashboard.

test_steps.action: Hover over the metric card.
test_steps.expected_result: The three-dot menu button becomes visible.

test_steps.action: Click the three-dot menu button.
test_steps.expected_result: A dropdown menu opens.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit' option in the dropdown menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The Edit page for the metric loads completely.

test_steps.action: Select the 'Target' tab if it is not already active.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration options are displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the 'Time-Based' radio button.
test_steps.expected_result: 'Start' and 'Target' input fields appear.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Start Value'.
test_steps.expected_result: The start value is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Enter the 'Target Value'.
test_steps.expected_result: The target value is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration is saved and the page navigates back to the dashboard.

test_steps.action: Locate the metric card on the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric card displays the time-based progress indicator, start value, and target value.

test_steps.action: Perform a final verification of the metric card's name, value, and target visualization.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric card correctly reflects the new time-based target configuration.

test_cases.name: Successful User Invitation and Account Onboarding
preconditions: An admin user is logged into the application.
The application is accessible at the specified Base URL.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the 'Administration' menu and expand it.
test_steps.expected_result: The Administration dropdown menu appears.

test_steps.action: Click on 'Manage Users'.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Manage Users' page loads successfully.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Invite Users' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Invite Users' modal appears.

test_steps.action: Enter the email address for the new user in the invite modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The email address is correctly entered.

test_steps.action: Set admin privileges based on test data.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Admin' checkbox state matches the test data.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Send Invite' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The invitation is sent and the modal closes.

test_steps.action: Verify the 'Pending Invitations' section is visible.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Pending Invitations' table is visible on the page.

test_steps.action: Locate the newly invited user in the pending table.
test_steps.expected_result: The invited user's email is found in the table.

test_steps.action: Click the accept invitation (tick/checkmark) icon for that user.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Accept Invite' form opens.

test_steps.action: On the 'Accept Invite' form, fill in the 'First Name'.
test_steps.expected_result: The first name is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Fill in the 'Last Name'.
test_steps.expected_result: The last name is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Fill in the 'Create Password' field.
test_steps.expected_result: The password is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Accept Invite' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The new user account is created successfully.

test_steps.action: Verify the user is successfully navigated to the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is logged in and the main dashboard page is displayed.
